What we did Working principles

Hypotheses #5

We believe that if we provide people with something that guides them to think about their risks (e.g. controls, actions, ratings and challenges)

We'll see less demand on BPs, better managed risks and more successful teams

We’ll know this is true when we see a reduction in the time BPs spend helping with data entry and an increase in the time spent on oversight, advice and challenge, we receive positive feedback from co-ordinators from user testing, ad hoc comments and as part of a quarterly survey

Related hypotheses

#1, #2 - this ‘tool’ supports these hypotheses

Considerations

  • It shouldn’t be about recording what they’ve done, it should be about helping them to manage their risk
  • Can it provide some form of ‘intelligent challenge’ for people, such as risk appetite, suitable controls etc
  • It needs to be communicated clearly, using the language your users use
  • It should be iterated, tested and improved
  • We need to identify how we get the current risks in there. Migrating current risks may result in poor quality stuff being copied over
  • Ensure accessibility is considered
